definition: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

variant of 啟|启[qi3]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
variant of 啟|启[qi3]

surname Hou

sentences.english: We think that Shangshu serves as a link between the past and the future in the development of the history of Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 在汉语史发展过程中，《尚书》具有承前启后的作用。

sentences.english: The transitional period of Chinese forensic medicine is in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝对法医学来说，是一个承前启后的时代。

sentences.english: It needs no saying that this meeting is of great significance, as it serves as a link between past and present.
sentences.chinese: 应该说，这次会议具有承前启后的重大意义。

definition: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
to play a critical role (idiom)/influential
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to set (sth) afoot/to initiate/beginning/origin/commencement
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
epoch-marking
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
thick and heavy in colors/to describe sth in colorful language with attention to detail (idiom)
